lessonActivities.title: Will: Your Future Superpower for Snap Decisions!
lessonActivities.content:
Hey future-teller! Imagine will as your instant superpower ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è ‚Äì it pops up when you predict, promise, or decide on the spot! Like grabbing an umbrella because clouds scream rain. ‚òÇÔ∏è

Predictions = what you think will happen. I think it will rain later.

Spontaneous decisions/offers = made now! I'll answer the phone!

Promises/threats = serious stuff. I will call you. / Stop or I'll tell!

Fun fact: 'Will' is like a magic wand ‚Äì wave it for instant future action! ‚ú®
examples: The sky is dark ‚Äì it will rain soon (prediction).
Phone ringing? I'll get it! (spontaneous offer).
I promise I will help you study tomorrow.
We won't be late ‚Äì I swear!
functions: Predicting weather or events without evidence
lessonActivities.tips: No plan yet? ‚Üí Use will for on-the-spot magic.

lessonActivities.title: Be Going To: Plans & Evidence Detective!
lessonActivities.content:
Detective mode on! üîç Be going to is your clue-hunter for plans already decided or evidence screaming 'it's happening!' Like dark clouds = rain incoming.

Plans/intentions = decided before speaking. I'm going to visit Bali next month.

Predictions with evidence = see it now? Predict it! Look at those clouds ‚Äì it's going to rain!

Fun fact: 'Gonna' is slang shortcut in chats/songs ‚Äì I'm gonna win! But write 'going to' in essays! üòé
examples: Tickets booked ‚Äì we're going to fly to Japan (plan).
He's running to the bus ‚Äì he's going to miss it (evidence).
She‚Äôs going to have a baby ‚Äì look at her belly!
I‚Äôve saved money ‚Äì I‚Äôm going to buy a new phone.
functions: Talking about fixed vacation or study plans
Predicting based on what you see/hear now
lessonActivities.tips: Decision made earlier or clear signs? ‚Üí Grab be going to.

lessonActivities.title: Future Continuous: Movie Scene in Progress!
lessonActivities.content:
Action! üé¨ Will be + -ing paints a future movie where you're in the middle of doing something. Like freezing a frame at 3 PM tomorrow.

Ongoing at a future time = continuous action. At 5 PM, I will be eating dinner.

Can use be going to be + -ing too ‚Äì same vibe!

Fun fact: It's like pausing a video game ‚Äì catch the action mid-level! üïπÔ∏è
examples: Tomorrow at noon, I will be flying over the ocean.
This time next week, we will be celebrating your birthday.
You will be sleeping when I arrive at midnight.
At 8 AM, she will be teaching English online.
functions: Describing what you'll be doing at a specific future moment
lessonActivities.tips: Focus on 'during' a time? ‚Üí Will be + -ing for the scene.

lessonActivities.title: Time Clauses: Present for Future Magic!
lessonActivities.content:
Time travel rule! üï∞Ô∏è In clauses with when/before/after/as soon as/until, use present simple even for future. Main clause? Future tense!

Rule: Time clause = present. I will call when I arrive. (Not will arrive)

Comma if time clause first: As soon as she finishes, we'll leave.

Fun fact: It's like a calendar reminder ‚Äì present triggers future action! üìÖ
examples: I'll cook dinner after I get home (present in clause).
Before we start the movie, she will arrive (comma rule).
We won't leave until you finish your homework.
As soon as the bell rings, students will run outside.
functions: Linking future events without repeating future tense
lessonActivities.tips: See when/after/etc.? ‚Üí Switch to present simple in that part.

lessonActivities.title: Will vs Be Going To: Prediction Showdown!
lessonActivities.content:
Battle time! ‚öîÔ∏è Both predict the future, but will = general guess, be going to = evidence-based. No proof? Will. See signs? Be going to!

The team will win the championship. (opinion) vs They‚Äôre leading 5-0 ‚Äì they‚Äôre going to win! (evidence)

Fun fact: Indonesians often mix them ‚Äì but in exams, evidence = be going to! üìù
examples: It will be hot tomorrow (weather forecast guess).
It‚Äôs going to be hot ‚Äì the sun is burning! (feeling heat now).
I think she‚Äôll pass (belief).
She studied all night ‚Äì she‚Äôs going to pass (proof).
lessonActivities.tips: Ask: Do I have proof now? ‚Üí Yes = be going to. No = will.

lessonActivities.title: Future in the Past: Was/Were Going To
lessonActivities.content:
Time machine rewind! ‚è™ Was/were going to = planned in past but maybe didn‚Äôt happen. Like I was going to call you, but my phone died.

Use for broken plans, expectations, or past intentions.

Fun fact: Like a 'future' that got stuck in traffic! üöóüí®
examples: I was going to study, but I fell asleep.
They were going to travel to Bali, but the volcano erupted.
She was going to be a doctor, but chose teaching.
lessonActivities.tips: Past plan, maybe failed? ‚Üí Was/were going to + verb.

writingActivities.question: You're at a caf√© with friends. It starts clouding over. Write 4 sentences: 1 will prediction, 1 be going to evidence, 1 spontaneous offer, 1 promise.
writingActivities.hint: Will: guess/offer. Be going to: signs. Promise: I will + verb.

writingActivities.question: Plan your dream weekend in Jakarta. Use be going to (2 plans), future continuous (2 specific times), and 1 time clause.
writingActivities.hint: Be going to = intention. Continuous = at X time. Clause = when/after + present.
sentenceStarters: I'm going to ___ Ancol on Saturday.

writingActivities.question: Write a short message to your teacher explaining why you missed class. Use was/were going to + 2 excuses and 1 future promise.
writingActivities.hint: Was going to = past plan. Promise = I will...
sentenceStarters: I was going to come, but ___

writingActivities.question: You're a weather reporter. Write a 5-sentence forecast for tomorrow using will (general), be going to (evidence), and future continuous (specific time).
writingActivities.hint: Will = likely. Be going to = radar shows. Continuous = at 3 PM.
sentenceStarters: Clouds are forming ‚Äì it ___ rain in Bandung.
At noon, people ___ enjoying the beach.

writingActivities.question: Write a diary entry about next year. Use be going to (3 plans), will (2 predictions), and 1 time clause with after.
writingActivities.hint: Plans = decided. Predictions = think. After + present.
sentenceStarters: Next year, I'm going to ___ university.
I think I ___ get a job.

writingActivities.question: Your friend is moving to Bali. Write a goodbye card with 2 promises (will), 1 future continuous scene, and 1 time clause with as soon as.
writingActivities.hint: Promise = I will. Continuous = you will be + ing. As soon as + present.
sentenceStarters: ___ I arrive, we'll go to the beach.

writingActivities.question: You're organizing a school event. Write 5 instructions using future continuous (ongoing tasks) and time clauses (sequence).
writingActivities.hint: Continuous = will be + ing during event. When/before + present.
sentenceStarters: At 8 AM, we ___ setting up chairs.

writingActivities.question: Write a short story beginning: 'Tomorrow was the big exam...'. Use will (nervous prediction), be going to (plan), future continuous (night before), and 1 time clause.
writingActivities.hint: Nervous = will. Plan = going to. Night = will be studying. Clause = before I sleep.

writingActivities.question: Your flight is delayed. Write a text to family with 2 be going to (new plans), 1 future continuous (during wait), and 1 time clause with until.
writingActivities.hint: New plan = going to. During = will be + ing. Until + present.

writingActivities.question: Imagine you're 10 years older. Write a letter to your younger self with 3 pieces of advice using will (prediction), be going to (plan), and was going to (past regret).
writingActivities.hint: Advice = you will. Plan = you should be going to. Regret = I was going to.
sentenceStarters: You should be going to ___ English daily.
I was going to ___ but didn't.

gameActivities.question: Deciding right now in response to hunger - what shows instant decision?
gameActivities.sentence: A: I'm hungry. B: ____ make nasi goreng!
gameActivities.hint: Spontaneous offer made now (Lesson 1: Will for instant decisions)

gameActivities.question: Predicting based on opinion, not current evidence - which form?
gameActivities.sentence: The sky is clear ‚Äì tomorrow ____ be sunny.
gameActivities.hint: General prediction without proof (Lesson 1: Will for predictions)

gameActivities.question: After 'when' in time clauses - which tense despite future meaning?
gameActivities.sentence: I'll call you when I ____ home.
gameActivities.hint: Time clause uses present (Lesson 4: Present in when clauses)

gameActivities.question: Decision made earlier with evidence (tickets) - which construction?
gameActivities.sentence: I've booked tickets ‚Äì we ____ to Bali!
gameActivities.hint: Plan made before now (Lesson 2: Be going to for plans)

gameActivities.question: In progress at a specific future time - painting the scene.
gameActivities.sentence: At 3 PM tomorrow, I ____ lunch with Rina.
gameActivities.hint: Ongoing at specific time (Lesson 3: Future Continuous for movie scene)

gameActivities.question: Visible sign (yawning) predicts what's coming - which form?
gameActivities.sentence: He's yawning ‚Äì he ____ asleep soon.
gameActivities.hint: Evidence you can see now (Lesson 2: Be going to with evidence)

gameActivities.question: Making a threat - which form shows consequences?
gameActivities.sentence: Do your homework or ____ no phone!
gameActivities.hint: Threat uses will (Lesson 1: Will for threats)

gameActivities.question: Past intention that didn't happen - which shows unfulfilled plan?
gameActivities.sentence: I ____ call you, but my battery died.
gameActivities.hint: Past plan interrupted (Lesson 6: Was going to for broken plans)

gameActivities.question: Two actions happening simultaneously in the future - both ongoing.
gameActivities.sentence: While I ____ homework, she ____ dinner.
gameActivities.hint: Both in progress together (Lesson 3: Parallel future actions)

gameActivities.question: Time clause starting the sentence - no future tense in that clause!
gameActivities.sentence: ____ the movie ends, we'll go home.
gameActivities.hint: Time word without will (Lesson 4: When clause = present)

gameActivities.question: Action in progress when interrupted - showing the ongoing activity.
gameActivities.sentence: I ____ TV when you arrive.
gameActivities.hint: Longer action being done (Lesson 3: Interrupted future continuous)

gameActivities.question: Describing party atmosphere - multiple activities happening.
gameActivities.sentence: At the party, people ____ and ____ music.
gameActivities.hint: Setting the scene (Lesson 3: Atmosphere with continuous)

gameActivities.question: General hope or belief about distant future - no evidence now.
gameActivities.sentence: Indonesia ____ win the World Cup one day.
gameActivities.hint: Opinion without proof (Lesson 5: Will for beliefs)

gameActivities.question: In the middle of starting at that exact time - continuous action.
gameActivities.sentence: At 6 PM, I ____ dinner.
gameActivities.hint: In progress at time (Lesson 3: Specific time with continuous)

gameActivities.question: Instant response to feeling hot - spontaneous decision.
gameActivities.sentence: A: It's hot. B: ____ open the window.
gameActivities.hint: Decided this moment (Lesson 1: Will for instant offers)

gameActivities.question: Main clause vs until clause - which gets which tense?
gameActivities.sentence: We ____ until you ____ ready.
gameActivities.hint: Until clause uses present (Lesson 4: Time clauses)

gameActivities.question: Temporary situation next year - emphasizing the ongoing period.
gameActivities.sentence: Next year, I ____ in Singapore.
gameActivities.hint: Temporary stay (Lesson 3: Future continuous for temporary)

gameActivities.question: Making a promise about the future - which form guarantees commitment?
gameActivities.sentence: Don't worry ‚Äì I ____ your secret.
gameActivities.hint: Promise (Lesson 1: Will for promises)

gameActivities.question: Current evidence (crying) shows what's about to happen.
gameActivities.sentence: The baby is crying ‚Äì he ____ hungry.
gameActivities.hint: Visible sign now (Lesson 2: Evidence-based prediction)

gameActivities.question: Time clause with 'as soon as' - present tense in that part!
gameActivities.sentence: ____ I ____ money, I'll buy a ticket.
gameActivities.hint: As soon as clause (Lesson 4: Present in time clauses)

gameActivities.question: Past intention stopped by circumstances - unfulfilled plan.
gameActivities.sentence: I ____ travel last year, but COVID stopped me.
gameActivities.hint: Broken past plan (Lesson 6: Was going to for regrets)

gameActivities.question: Spontaneous offer to help - decided at this moment.
gameActivities.sentence: A: Heavy bag? B: ____ help you.
gameActivities.hint: Instant help offer (Lesson 1: Will for spontaneous offers)

gameActivities.question: Festival scene with ongoing activities - setting the atmosphere.
gameActivities.sentence: At the festival, children ____ games and adults ____ food.
gameActivities.hint: Scene description (Lesson 3: Atmosphere setting)

gameActivities.question: Scientific prediction about distant future - general belief.
gameActivities.sentence: Scientists say robots ____ our jobs in 50 years.
gameActivities.hint: General future (Lesson 5: Will for predictions)

gameActivities.question: In progress at midnight - celebrating during that time.
gameActivities.sentence: At midnight, I ____ the New Year.
gameActivities.hint: Ongoing at specific time (Lesson 3: Future continuous)

gameActivities.question: Before clause at the start - use present tense there!
gameActivities.sentence: ____ you ____, lock the door.
gameActivities.hint: Before clause = present (Lesson 4: Time clause rule)

gameActivities.question: His face shows clear evidence - prediction based on what you see.
gameActivities.sentence: Look at his face ‚Äì he ____ the exam!
gameActivities.hint: Evidence visible (Lesson 2: Be going to with proof)

gameActivities.question: Action in progress when power cut happened - interrupted activity.
gameActivities.sentence: I ____ when the power went out.
gameActivities.hint: Interrupted future (Lesson 3: Continuous for interruption)

gameActivities.question: Threatening consequence if they don't comply.
gameActivities.sentence: Be quiet or ____ to the principal!
gameActivities.hint: Threat (Lesson 1: Will for threats)

gameActivities.question: BOSS: 'The moment' time clause - present tense despite future meaning!
gameActivities.sentence: ____ you ____ the bell, run!
gameActivities.hint: The moment clause (Lesson 4: All time clauses use present)

quizActivities.question: What do you use 'will' for when making a spontaneous offer?
quizActivities.sentence: A: I'm too tired to do the dishes. B: ____ do them for you!
quizActivities.hint: A spontaneous offer is made right now without planning - use 'will'

quizActivities.question: Which form shows a plan made before this moment?
quizActivities.sentence: I've already decided and bought tickets ‚Äì we ____ to Tokyo next month.
quizActivities.hint: When you already decided and have evidence (tickets bought), use 'be going to'

quizActivities.question: What verb form completes this time clause correctly?
quizActivities.sentence: I will text you when I ____ the store.
quizActivities.hint: Time clauses (when, before, after, as soon as) use present simple, not future tense

quizActivities.question: What is happening at a specific future time?
quizActivities.sentence: At 10 PM tomorrow, I ____ my favorite show.
quizActivities.hint: For actions happening at a specific time in the future, use future continuous (will be + -ing)

quizActivities.question: Which shows a prediction based on what you observe right now?
quizActivities.sentence: Look at those dark clouds! It ____ rain very soon.
quizActivities.hint: When you see evidence happening now (dark clouds), use 'be going to' for prediction

quizActivities.question: What's the best choice for a general prediction about the future?
quizActivities.sentence: I think she ____ become a great doctor someday.
quizActivities.hint: For general predictions without specific evidence, use 'will'

quizActivities.question: Choose the correct tense for this mixed sentence:
quizActivities.sentence: We ____ arrive at 6 PM, so when you ____ home, we ____ already there.
options: are going to / reach / will be
quizActivities.hint: Use 'will' for the main clause, present in the time clause, and 'will be' to complete the sentence

quizActivities.question: What's happening continuously at a future time?
quizActivities.sentence: At noon tomorrow, we ____ in class.
quizActivities.hint: Use future continuous (will be + -ing) for actions in progress at a specific future time

spellingActivities.hint: Plan or purpose (be going to shows ___)
Guess about future (will or be going to)

spellingActivities.sentence: It was a ___ decision to help.
I made a ___ to study daily.
